name: A JMORROW/RALZZZ Quiz | Words in Words for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMORROW" and "RALZZZ", find a 3-letter word meaning a place where animals are kept.
questions.explanation:
Zoo.

	A zoo is a place where a bunch of animals are.  People can pay to go in there and see all sorts of different animals, from anteaters to zebras!

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMORROW" and "RALZZZ", find a 4-letter word meaning a type of music where you might hear the saxophone.
questions.explanation:
Jazz.

	Jazz used to be spelled "jass", if you can believe that!  Jazz is a type of music that can be very peaceful and relaxing.  Louis Armstrong was very famous in the jazz industry.  He sang songs like "What a Wonderful World".

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMORROW", find a 4-letter word meaning a place in a house, which can be after the words bed, bath, living, or dining.
questions.explanation:
Room.

	A room is a place in a house that often has four walls, though some living rooms, kitchens, and dining rooms have only a few walls and it is very open between the rooms.  A bedroom is where you sleep, a bathroom is where you see a toilet, and the family room is a place similar to the living room.  There are all sorts of different rooms in a house!

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMORROW" and "RALZZZ", find a 3-letter word meaning jelly.
questions.explanation:
Jam.

	Though jam and jelly are often confused as being the same thing, there is actually a difference.  Jelly uses just the juices of a fruit to make the jelly, a jam uses the whole fruit.

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMORROW" and "RALZZZ", find a 4-letter word for the soft stuff on a sheep.
questions.explanation:
Wool.

	Wool is a very soft substance that grows on a sheep.  After a certain amount of time, wool is shaved off of the sheep, and the wool is used to makes sweaters and blankets and such.

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMORROW", find a 4-letter word for a squirmy animal that you see in the dirt, that often follows the word "earth".
questions.explanation:
Worm.

	A worm is a very squishy and squirmy animal that eats dirt.  Worms, also called earthworms, fertilize the soil when they eat the dirt and then deposit it back with more nutrients.

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMORROW" and "RALZZZ", find a 3-letter word meaning not cooked.
questions.explanation:
Raw.

	If something is raw, it is not yet cooked.  For instance, many people bring a plate of raw vegetables to a party to snack on.  Raw veggies are a very healthy snack, because they have not lost all the nutrients that are usually lost when cooked.

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMORROW" and "RALZZZ", find a 3-letter word for a bird that comes out at night.
questions.explanation:
Owl.

	An owl is a type of bird that is nocturnal, which means "active at night".  Owls have very good eyesight, so they can see a little mouse in a field in the dark!  They are also very quiet flyers, so their prey will not hear them coming.

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMORROW" and "RALZZZ", find a 3-letter word for a glass container that you might store something in.
questions.explanation:
Jar.

	A jar is usually a class container that stores things such as food.  Many people have jelly in mason jars.  Mason jars are just a type of jar that, when the contents are heated, the jar seals shut.

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMORROW" and "RALZZZ", find a 4-letter word meaning the opposite of cool.
questions.explanation:
Warm.

	If something is warm, it is not quite hot, but it still has some heat to it.  For instance, a blanket is nice and warm on a cold day, but it isn't hot, so it certainly won't burn you or make you sweat!
